Meta.ShortDescription: Staphylococcus is a genus of Gram-positive bacteria that can cause a wide variety of infections in humans and other animals through infection or the production of toxins.

Symptoms.Symptom: Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome, a cutaneious reaction to exotoxin in the bloodstream
Collection of pus, boil, furuncle, or abscess
Area is typically tender or painful
Area may be reddened or swollen
Genitourinatry tract infections in sexually active young women

Diagnostics.Diagnostic: Bacterium culture from blood, urine, sputum, or other fluid samples

Treatments.Treatment: Location and history related to the infection determines the treatment.
Anti-staphylococcal beta-lactam antibiotics, such as cephalexin
